qas.question: What helped increase the Bomber Command's offensives?

answers.text: bombers should strike a single target each night and use more incendiaries because they had a greater impact on production than high explosives

qas.question: What caused the most production disruption?

answers.text: when city centres were devastated through the loss of administrative offices, utilities and transport.

qas.question: What did the experience of German's using incendiaries mean?

answers.text: using incendiaries was the way forward for operations over Germany.

context: The relieved British began to assess the impact of the Blitz in August 1941, and the RAF Air Staff used <a0_0>the German experience<a0_0/> to improve Bomber Command's offensives. They concluded <a1_0>bombers should strike a single target each night and use more incendiaries because they had a greater impact on production than high explosives<a1_0/>. They also noted regional production was severely disrupted <a2_0>when city centres were devastated through the loss of administrative offices, utilities and transport.<a2_0/> They believed the Luftwaffe had <a3_0>failed in precision attack<a3_0/>, and concluded the German example of area attack <a4_0>using incendiaries was the way forward for operations over Germany.
